Key Match Events: Trent Grisham hit a game-ending grand slam in the ninth inning
Wyatt Langford made a leaping catch at the top of the wall in left field on a 104 mph liner from Giancarlo Stanton with two runners on after Trent Grisham's two-out grand slam
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Judge and Juan Soto had left the game in the eighth inning due to a 10-2 deficit
The Yankees are currently without a specific closer after two-time All-Star Clay Holmes gave up Langfordâ€™s drive with New York on the cusp of a series victory in the middle game against the Rangers
Manager Aaron Boone emphasized the importance of playing their best ball and putting their best foot forward with 22 games remaining
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge stated that the team needs to look forward and get ready for the next series in Chicago
Aaron Boone highlighted the team's opportunity to reach their hopes and dreams despite their current standings
Miscellaneous Highlights: Second baseman Gleyber Torres did not react quickly enough to a speedy Langford trying to turn an RBI hit into a double
Reliever Tim Mayza allowed three consecutive baserunners in the sixth
Mark Leiter Jr. gave up a double before a wild pitch that capped a three-run inning for an 8-2 Texas lead
